concept.title: IEC 61850 PXP List

othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: PXP interface listing and parameter notes for protection extension modules and IEC 61850 integration.

conbody.p: The default logical device (LD) for allExept the “System physical device proxy status” which uses the LD: V1_SYSTEM. IEC tags for PXP is V1_PXP_1_ LD1.

The IEC tag path format is LN$FC$DO$DA.
Logical node (LN)
Functional constraint (FC)
Data object (DO)
Data attribute (DA)
conbody.note: Depending on the system type and design, some values might not be available.

entry.p: Modbus physical device proxy status if proxy Yes=1, No=0.
System physical device proxy status if proxy Yes=1, No=0.
If the "System switched on" is active, then the Integer value in stVal is 1. If the "System switched on" is not active, then the Integer value in stVal is 0.
If UPS the system is running in "Standby", then the Integer value in stVal is 1.
If UPS system is running in "Normal operation", then the Integer value in stVal is 1.
If UPS system is running in "Battery operation", then the Integer value in stVal is 1.
If UPS system is running in "Bypass operation", then the Integer value in stVal is 1.
If the "Common Alarm" is active, then the Integer value in stVal is 0. If the "Common Alarm" is not active, then the Integer value in stVal is 1.
If the "EPO" is active, then the Boolean value in stVal is 1 (true). If the "EPO" is not active, then the Integer value in stVal is 0 (false).
If the "Fan Failure" alarm is active, then the Boolean value in stVal is 1 (true). If the "Fan Failure" alarm is not active, then the Boolean value in stVal is 0 (false).
If the "General Mains fault" alarm is active, then the Boolean value in stVal is 1 (true). If the "General Mains fault" alarm is not active, then the Boolean value in stVal is 0 (false).
If the "Mains RMS Fault" alarm is active, then the Boolean value in stVal is 1 (true). If the "Mains RMS Fault" alarm is not active, then the Boolean value in stVal is 0 (false).
If the "Mains input RMS Fault" alarm is active, then the Boolean value in stVal is 1 (true). If the "Mains input RMS Fault" alarm is not active, then the Boolean value in stVal is 0 (false).
If the "General Bypass fault" alarm is active, then the Boolean value in stVal is 1 (true). If the "General Bypass fault" alarm is not active, then the Boolean value in stVal is 0 (false).
If the "Bypass RMS Fault" alarm is active, then the Boolean value in stVal is 1 (true). If the "Bypass RMS Fault" alarm is not active, then the Boolean value in stVal is 0 (false).
If the "Bypass input RMS Fault" alarm is active, then the Boolean value in stVal is 1 (true). If the "Bypass input RMS Fault" alarm is not active, then the Boolean value in stVal is 0 (false).
If the "General Output fault" alarm is active, then the Boolean value in stVal is 1 (true). If the "General Output fault" alarm is not active, then the Boolean value in stVal is 0 (false).
If the "Output RMS Fault" alarm is active, then the Boolean value in stVal is 1 (true). If the "Output RMS Fault" alarm is not active, then the Boolean value in stVal is 0 (false).
If the "Inverter output RMS Fault" alarm is active, then the Boolean value in stVal is 1 (true). If the "Inverter output RMS Fault" alarm is not active, then the Boolean value in stVal is 0 (false).
If the "Inverter Asynchronous" alarm is active, then the Boolean value in stVal is 1 (true). If the "Inverter Asynchronous" alarm is not active, then the Boolean value in stVal is 0 (false).
If the "Output overloaded" alarm is active, then the Boolean value in stVal is 1 (true). If the "Output overloaded" alarm is not active, then the Boolean value in stVal is 0 (false).
If the "PSU fault" alarm is active, then the Boolean value in stVal is 1 (true). If the "PSU fault" alarm is not active, then the Boolean value in stVal is 0 (false).
If the "Overtemperature" alarm is active, then the Boolean value in stVal is 1 (true). If the "Overtemperature" alarm is not active, then the Boolean value in stVal is 0 (false).
If the "T001 Overtemperature" alarm is active, then the Boolean value in stVal is 1 (true). If the "T001 Overtemperature" alarm is not active, then the Boolean value in stVal is 0 (false).

If the "T001 Temperarure sensor fault" alarm is active, then the Boolean value in stVal is 1 (true). If the "T001 Temperarure sensor fault" alarm is not active, then the Boolean value in stVal is 0 (false).
If the "T401 Overtemperature" alarm is active, then the Boolean value in stVal is 1 (true). If the "T401 Overtemperature" alarm is not active, then the Boolean value in stVal is 0 (false).

If the "T501 Overtemperature" alarm is active, then the Boolean value in stVal is 1 (true). If the "T501 Overtemperature" alarm is not active, then the Boolean value in stVal is 0 (false).

If the "T501 Temperarure sensor fault" alarm is active, then the Boolean value in stVal is 1 (true). If the "T501 Temperarure sensor fault" alarm is not active, then the Boolean value in stVal is 0 (false).
If the "Rectifier fault / error" alarm is active, then the Integer value in stVal is 1. If the "Rectifier fault / error" alarm is not active, then the Integer value in stVal is 0.
If the "Inverter fault / error" alarm is active, then the Integer value in stVal is 1. If the "Inverter fault / error" alarm is not active, then the Integer value in stVal is 0.
If UPS system is in battery charging mode "Inital charge", then the Integer value in stVal is 1.
If UPS system is in battery charging mode "Float charge", then the Integer value in stVal is 2.
If UPS system is in battery charging mode "Boost charge", then the Integer value in stVal is 4.
If UPS system is in battery charging mode "Cycle charge", then the Integer value in stVal is 8.
If the "Battery test active" status is active, then the Boolean value in stVal is 1 (true). If the "Battery test active" status is not active, then the Boolean value in stVal is 0 (false).

If the "Battery temperature warning" alarm is active, then the Boolean value in stVal is 1 (true). If the "Battery temperature warning" alarm is not active, then the Boolean value in stVal is 0 (false).

Present Input mains frequency value in Hertz. The value in mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 51.2 Hz).
Present Input mains voltage value in Volts between phase L1 and phase L2. The value in phsAB$cVal$mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 456.7 V).
Present Input mains voltage value in Volts between phase L2 and phase L3. The value in phsBC$cVal$mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 456.7 V).
Present Input mains voltage value in Volts between phase L3 and phase L1. The value in phsCA$cVal$mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 456.7 V).
Present Input mains current value in Ampere of phase L1. The value in phsA$cVal$mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 123.4 A).
Present Input mains current value in Ampere of phase L2. The value in phsB$cVal$mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 123.4 A).
Present Input mains current value in Ampere of phase L3. The value in phsC$cVal$mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 123.4 A).
Present Input mains voltage mean value in Volts . The value in zavg$cVal$mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 456.7 V).
Present Input mains current mean value in Amp . The value in zavg$cVal$mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 123.4 A).
Mains voltage max L1 since last reading [V]
Maximum Input mains voltage value in Volts between phase L1 and phase L2, which has been recorded during operation. The value in mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 456.7 V).
Mains voltage max L2 since last reading [V]
Maximum Input mains voltage value in Volts between phase L2 and phase L3, which has been recorded during operation. The value in mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 456.7 V).
Mains voltage max L3 since last reading [V]
Maximum Input mains voltage value in Volts between phase L3 and phase L1, which has been recorded during operation. The value in mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 456.7 V).
Mains voltage min L1 since last reading [V]
Minimum Input mains voltage value in Volts between phase L1 and phase L2, which has been recorded during operation. The value in mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 456.7 V).
Mains voltage min L2 since last reading [V]
Minimum Input mains voltage value in Volts between phase L2 and phase L3, which has been recorded during operation. The value in mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 456.7 V).
Present Rectifier Input voltage value in Volts between phase L1 and phase L2. The value in phsAB$cVal$mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 456.7 V).
Present Rectifier Input voltage value in Volts between phase L2 and phase L3. The value in phsBC$cVal$mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 456.7 V).
Present Rectifier Input voltage value in Volts between phase L3 and phase L1. The value in phsCA$cVal$mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 456.7 V).
Present Input bypass frequency value in Hertz. The value in mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 51.2 Hz).
Present Input bypass voltage value in Volts between phase L1 and phase L2. The value in phsAB$cVal$mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 456.7 V).
Present Input bypass voltage value in Volts between phase L2 and phase L3. The value in phsBC$cVal$mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 456.7 V).
Present Input bypass voltage value in Volts between phase L3 and phase L1. The value in phsCA$cVal$mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 456.7 V).
Present Input bypass voltage mean value in Volts. The value in zavg$cVal$mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 456.7 V).
Present Input bypass current value in Ampere of phase L1. The value in phsA$cVal$mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 123.4 A).
Present Input bypass current value in Ampere of phase L2. The value in phsB$cVal$mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 123.4 A).
Present Input bypass current value in Ampere of phase L3. The value in phsC$cVal$mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 123.4 A).
Present SBS mean average voltage value in Volts between all three phases. The value in zavg$cVal$mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 456.7 V).
Present SBS input voltage value in Volts between phase L1 and phase L2. The value in phsAB$cVal$mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 456.7 V).
Present SBS input voltage value in Volts between phase L2 and phase L3. The value in phsBC$cVal$mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 456.7 V).
Present SBS input voltage value in Volts between phase L3 and phase L1. The value in phsCA$cVal$mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 456.7 V).
Present Inverter output voltage value in Volts between phase L1 and phase L2. The value in phsAB$cVal$mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 456.7 V).
Present Inverter output voltage value in Volts between phase L2 and phase L3. The value in phsBC$cVal$mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 456.7 V).
Present Inverter output voltage value in Volts between phase L3 and phase L1. The value in phsCA$cVal$mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 456.7 V).
Present Output frequency value in Hertz. The value in mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 51.2 Hz).
Present Output voltage value in Volts between phase L1 and phase L2. The value in phsAB$cVal$mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 456.7 V).
Present Output voltage value in Volts between phase L2 and phase L3. The value in phsBC$cVal$mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 456.7 V).
Present Output voltage value in Volts between phase L3 and phase L1. The value in phsCA$cVal$mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 456.7 V).
Present Output current value in Ampere of phase L1. The value in phsA$cVal$mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 123.4 A).
Present Output current value in Ampere of phase L2. The value in phsB$cVal$mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 123.4 A).
Present Output current value in Ampere of phase L3. The value in phsC$cVal$mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 123.4 A).
Present Output voltage mean value in Volts. The value in phsAB$cVal$mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 456.7 V).
Present Output current mean value in Ampere. The value in zavg$cVal$mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 123.4 A).
Output peak current L1 since last reading [A]
Maximum Output current value in Ampere of phase L1, which has been recorded during operation. The value in mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 123.4 A).
Output peak current L2 since last reading [A]
Maximum Output current value in Ampere of phase L2, which has been recorded during operation. The value in mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 123.4 A).
Output peak current L3 since last reading [A]
Maximum Output current value in Ampere of phase L3, which has been recorded during operation. The value in mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 123.4 A).
Percentage of apparent output load of total UPS system. The value in zloadPerc is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 45.3 %). For UPS configured as single system.
Percentage of real output load of total UPS system. The value in zloadPerc is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 45.3 %). For UPS configured as single system.
Apparent output load in kVA of total UPS system. The value in mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 34.5 kVA). For UPS configured as single system.
Real output load in kW of total UPS system. The value in mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 34.5 kW). For UPS configured as single system.
Apparent output power in kVA of phase L1. The value in phsA$cVal$mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 34.5 kVA).
Apparent output power in kVA of phase L2. The value in phsB$cVal$mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 34.5 kVA).
Apparent output power in kVA of phase L3. The value in phsC$cVal$mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 34.5 kVA).
Real output power in kW of phase L1. The value in phsA$cVal$mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 34.5 kVA).
Real output power in kW of phase L2. The value in phsB$cVal$mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 34.5 kVA).
Real output power in kW of phase L3. The value in phsC$cVal$mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 34.5 kVA).
Output power factor (cos phi) of phase L1. The value in phsA$cVal$mag$f is given with 2 digits after the dot (e.g.: 0.98).
Output power factor (cos phi) of phase L2. The value in phsB$cVal$mag$f is given with 2 digits after the dot (e.g.: 0.98).
Output power factor (cos phi) of phase L3. The value in phsC$cVal$mag$f is given with 2 digits after the dot (e.g.: 0.98).
Percentage of apparent output load of total UPS system. The value in zloadPerc is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 45.3 %). For UPS configured as redundant system.
Percentage of real output load of total UPS system. The value in zloadPerc is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 45.3 %). For UPS configured as redundant system.
Apparent output load in kVA of total UPS system. The value in mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 34.5 kVA). For UPS configured as redundant system.
Real output load in kW of total UPS system. The value in mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 34.5 kW). For UPS configured as redundant system.
Present Battery current value in Ampere. The value in mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 123.4 A).
Present Battery voltage value in Volts. The value in mag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 456.7 V).
Maximum Battery Voltage Since Last Reading [V]
Maximum Battery voltage value, which has been recorded during operation. The value in setMag$f is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 456.7 V).
Present Battery temperature value in Degree Celsius. The value in mag$f is given without digit after the dot (e.g.: 35 Degree Celsius).

Expected Battery runtime value in minutes. The value in stVal is given without digit after the dot (e.g.: 35 minutes). Ths value is only available if the optional Advanced Battery Montoring (ABM) is installed in the UPS system.
Percentage of Battery capacity of battery. The value in stVal is given with 1 digit after the dot (e.g.: 45.3 %).
Present External Temperature Sensor 1 value in Degree Celsius. The value in mag$f is given without digit after the dot (e.g.: 35 Degree Celsius).
Present External Temperature Sensor 2 value in Degree Celsius. The value in mag$f is given without digit after the dot (e.g.: 35 Degree Celsius).
Present External Temperature Sensor 3 value in Degree Celsius. The value in mag$f is given without digit after the dot (e.g.: 35 Degree Celsius).
Present Rectifier Mains Transformer (T001) Temperature in Degree Celsius. The value in mag$f is given without digit after the dot (e.g.: 35 Degree Celsius).
Present Bypass Transformer (T401) Temperature in Degree Celsius. The value in mag$f is given without digit after the dot (e.g.: 35 Degree Celsius).
Present Output Transformer (T501) Temperature in Degree Celsius. The value in mag$f is given without digit after the dot (e.g.: 35 Degree Celsius).
